reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on other Trip Advisor reviews and was pleased.
reviews.title: Excellent location, good standard and good value

likes.disliked: — Braekfast was not quite up to the standard of the rest of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights (spending 2 days in Monaco at the Historic Grand Prix). The hotel is not wonderful, beautiful or exotic, but it is clean and comfortable with reasonable facilities, modern bathroom fittings, very helpful staff etc. The location is excellent - approx 100 metres from the sea front and within easy walking of the old town. Despite the great location, the hotel is quiet at night.
reviews.title: Nice/Adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to get to the train station without a 20 minute walk, walk to Place Massenet, spend 1 euro on a tram ticket and 2 stops later you are at the station.
reviews.title: value for money
Great Location
reviews.text: About the only thing which was mediocre was the breakfast - 8 euros - we used it on 3 mornings when we were in a rush, but there are loads of alternate cafes close by, which we used on the other days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked direct via the hotel website - it can be a bit of a pain to find on Google etc (dozens of agency sites but I prefer to book direct). If you want to find the hotels website the easiest way I found was to look for 'Hotel Regence Nice' on Google which gets you to the website for the small group which includes the Massenet.We saved a few pennies by opting for a basic room and were very happy with the standard - and got exactly what we asked for. From the hotel room plan / fire information, there are a few odd shaped rooms - ours (109) was not absolutely rectangular, but it was fine.
reviews.title: Cheap and Well Located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a medium-sized hotel, well-situated between the pedestrian shopping area and the Promenade des Anglais. From similarity of decor, I would guess that it is a sister establishment to the nearby Hotel Regence.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would echo the earlier positive reviews. We had a comfortable good-sized room, spotlessly clean and very quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was adequate but nothing special, usual French rolls, croissants etc, there are plenty of cafes close by to offer an alternative.
reviews.title: Better than Expected

likes.disliked: — The TV is tiny.....really need a larger screen for that size of room

reviews.title: Fussy female West Midlands
reviews.text: I have stayed in around 8 hotels in Nice over the last few years, and think this one is probably overall the one I would choose to return to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked all the hotels for our recent trip to Europe based on TA recommendations. The Massenet was the only one I was unsure about going in.....the reviews were positive, but the property looked run down from the available pictures. Turns out the pics do not do it justice and our fellow TA'ers did not fail us. It is brighter, more modern, cleaner and nicer than I expected. The room we had was by far the largest of any place we stayed the entire trip. Definitely on the minimal side as far as furnishings, but the carpet and paint look recent and the bathroom was bright and spotless. The bed was comfortable and we never heard anything from the adjacent rooms. The breakfast is skimpy....probably not worth the 8 Euros extra except for the convenience. All the people we dealt with at the front desk were great.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: The real advantage of the Massenet is location: although there is no view, it's a block from the beach and just off the pedestrian mall loaded with shops, restaurants and bars. For most people, the hotel is probably too far to walk to from the train station with luggage; cab was about 15 Euros. However, we did walk to and from the station for a day trip to Monaco (highly recommended and only 6 Euro round trip), and it was interesting to see what Nice looks like away from the beaches (about 25 minute walk from hotel).
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent 4 nights at The Massenet so thought I would give you my take on the place. I will start off by letting you know what you can & can't expect.
reviews.title: What I think

likes.disliked: — Nothing major that would stop me staying again if I were to go back to Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What you don't get..
reviews.title: Thanks, Trip Advisors!

reviews.text: Tea & Coffee making facilities in your room
reviews.title: very relaxing holiday. Geordie couple, Newcastle

reviews.text: A lot of hanging space (5 hangers between 2 of us for a 4 day stay)
reviews.title: A Gem

reviews.text: A varied breakfast
reviews.title: Lovely little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the Massenet was perfect. It was on a quiet street but central to everything. The parking was 10 euros a day. Which was reasonable. The hotel staff was excellent. We were driving a big A6 stationwagon and the staff allowed us to park it in the front of the hotel which it usually reserved for the hotel staff as we could not get the beast down into the garage. We did not take advantage of the breakfast as there were ample places around the hotel to eat. There was also a laundry a couple of blocks away if you wished to do your own wash. Each load cost 4 euros 60 and the soap was 0.30 euros. The room was very clean and has a safe. The air conditioning was a bit weak but welcomed considering it was 32 C when we were in Nice. You have to leave a card in the slot by the door to keep the air running when you out of the room. I just used an old customer card from a men's shop to keep it running. It also had an elevator which was great.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found this to be a no frills Hotel,The most important thing for me has got to be cleanliness and I was not dissappointed.I stayed on the third floor,which meant it was peacefull no street noise.The room looked as though it had been carpeted recently,the bathroom which was seperate from the toilet had been newly replaced so everything was new and nicely done.The only drawback with the room for me was the bed-it was brick hard(I have a memory foam one)so I ended up buying an air bed to put on top of the matress.There isn`t a bar but there`s a fridge in the room this was a bonus as the price of a coke is shocking so we got some from the local Spar and also bought wine etc. The Euro Footy was on so we watched it on the big tele in the lounge area and sat with our wine there also.The Staff were extremely helpfull especially George the head receptionist he is a very nice person who is a font of knowledge if there is anything he doesn`t know he will find out for you.The two young men who shared night duties Rannee(may not be the right spelling) and Christoff were also very obliging.The bargain of the holiday had to be the bus trips for €1 Cannes ,Entibe ,Grasse ,Monnacco,anywhere you went was €1If travelling by train take plenty change and use the automated ticket machine as the queues for the tellers are long.Enjoy yourself
reviews.title: The Staff are Gems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hubby booked this for my 40th and I absolutely loved it. Great little hotel for the price. Bedroom and bathroom very clean, spacious, modern and quiet room, which is what my husband had requested. No tea or coffee making facilities but that does not bother us, the fridge in the room kept all our drinks perfectly chilled for us. Breakfast basic but adequate for what I eat. Hotel staff a complete pleasure to speak to and the location was perfect. I can't wait to go back and yes you could get bigger and better but Nice is expensive and we were more than happy with what we got for the price paid. Must mention the restaurant that we found off one of the side streets near the flower market. It was called La Ferme Saleya and the meal was just so nice, reasonable and the service was spot on. This was our first time in France, wish we had done it sooner, as it is just so beautiful and the people, contrary to what we had expected were so helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble for anyone.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right then, I paid £200 for 3 nights with my partner in a double room bed and breakfast. We were on the second floor.
reviews.title: Not a bad hotel at all.. although depends on what you want from it!

likes.liked: — Nice touches like the amazing carpet and electric shutters
likes.disliked: — It could of been so much better. Rubbish breakfast too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lot of people have touched on what you don't get and such but I'll do everything from my own point of view.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel
